Drew Carson.Action: Receives a beautifully handmade Shaolin uniform with his name embroidered, impressing the class and Kwan.
Is absent when the uniform is presented and when Kwan addresses the class, leaving others confused about what to do next.
Hurries over to help Master Kwan up after the fight, showing concern.
Apologizes sincerely to Kwan after accidentally scalding him with hot wax.
Holds out his hand to receive the tape from Kwan and smiles a defeated smile, showing acceptance and respect despite disagreement.
Responds to stepfather Bob's anger with sarcasm and a threat to exclude him from his future success.
Attempts to defuse tension by addressing Bob calmly initially ('Look, Bob, I'm not bothering you, am I?').
Refuses to accept Bob as his father figure ('I'm not your son, Bob. Lay off.'), showing emotional distance and defensiveness.
Refuses to study tapes initially, relying on outdated or less effective methods.
Accepts the tape from Kwan and smiles a defeated smile, showing willingness to adapt.
Engages in a tense, confrontational exchange with his stepfather, showing confidence but poor emotional control.
Responds to Bob's sarcastic taunt by telling him to leave him alone and asserts he never asked for anything from Bob.
Responds sharply and walks away from confrontation, showing emotional control and focus on training.
Walks into the tournament area in an ill-fitting handmade suit, recognized by people as he passes by.
Watches others win and continues to win himself, showing focus and determination but no explicit interaction.
Wins fights in the tournament despite wearing an ill-fitting suit, showing focus and skill.
Watches competitor Trevor win repeatedly, indicating awareness of competition and stakes.
Accepts a sip of water from a battered paper cup offered sheepishly by Kwan, showing humility and tolerance despite his disadvantaged situation.
Fights honorably despite being outmatched and humiliated by Trevor's unsportsmanlike conduct (pants pulled down), showing resilience and dignity.
Shakes his head and admits to Master Kwan that he can't continue training and is not getting better.
Walks silently with Kwan, contemplative and pensive, showing vulnerability and openness.
Avoids confrontation or retaliation after public humiliation in the ring, quietly packing up his stuff.
Tries to crawl out of the ring after losing and being publicly humiliated.
Contemplates the future and past silently while walking, showing introspection but no immediate action.
Expresses doubt about his own progress and suggests his master find a new student, showing lack of confidence in his abilities.
Listens attentively and meets Kwan's gaze with curiosity and respect.
Does not interrupt or challenge Kwan's confession about his past and limitations.
Shows no visible frustration or anger when Kwan admits he cannot fully help him.
Listens attentively and meets Kwan's gaze, showing engagement and openness to learning.
Shows curiosity by questioning Kwan about the stories, indicating critical thinking.
No direct action demonstrating skill or confidence in this excerpt; mostly receiving information.
Responds to Kwan's honesty with a smile and determination rather than anger.
Insists on going to the Shaolin Temple to train himself and improve.
Politely refuses Kwan's offer to pay for his ticket, showing independence and respect.
Bows respectfully to Kwan, showing sincerity and respect.
Formulates a clear goal to become a Shaolin warrior after learning Kwan is not one, showing insight and determination.
Insists on going to the Shaolin Temple for proper training to improve himself, demonstrating proactive problem-solving and confidence.
Refuses Kwan's offer to pay for his ticket, expressing independence and self-reliance.
Accepts a ticket from Kwan and bows respectfully before departure.
Observes and respects local customs and people during his run through Beijing.
Shares a crowded train ride with locals, sits humbly on his backpack, and responds to an old man's smile.
Takes initiative to travel alone to China, packs and navigates airport and train station independently.
Hesitates briefly before forcing his way onto the overcrowded train, then adapts by sitting on his pack.
Observes surroundings carefully during his run through Beijing, noting cultural details and people.
Politely asks a woman at a drink stand for directions and pays for a drink.
Greets a group of girls with 'Hello, ladies!' and asks for directions.
Expresses frustration and impatience when people do not understand or respond helpfully.
Stops at a drink stand and orders a drink despite being in an unfamiliar place.
Asks multiple people for directions to the Shaolin Temple, showing persistence.
Walks aimlessly at one point, indicating some lack of preparation or local knowledge.
Expresses frustration and impatience when people do not understand him or speak English.
Apologizes for expecting others to speak English, admits his mistake.
Accepts Ashema's offer to take him to the temple without hesitation.
Engages playfully by looking for bumps on the bike ride, sharing a light moment with Ashema.
Admits he is flustered when confronted about language expectations.
Expresses pride and clear intention to join the temple as a monk.
Successfully rides a bicycle while balancing a passenger, even seeking bumps to make the ride more exciting.
Shows some initial awkwardness and lack of cultural awareness (expecting others to speak English).
Thanks Ashema sincerely for the ride and expresses hope to see her again.
Wanders through the temple quietly, looking for someone to talk to but does not intrude or disturb the monks chanting.
Expresses awe and respect upon seeing the Shaolin Temple, quietly explores the temple interior, and seeks interaction with monks.
Distractedly responds to Ashema and shows some social awkwardness.
Wanders through the temple unnoticed by monks and leaves the chanting hall without engaging.
Bows respectfully to a monk and tries to ask a question politely.
Makes a sarcastic and somewhat rude comment to a monk ('Huh, baldy? Shine your head for a quarter?') out of frustration.
Claps and compliments the monks after their chanting performance.
Attempts to engage with the monks and masters by speaking to them and showing interest in their training.
Fails to get any response or acknowledgment from the monks despite repeated attempts, showing some frustration and lack of understanding of the cultural or situational context.
Claps after the chanting stops, mistakenly treating it as a performance, which shows a lack of cultural awareness and understanding.
Insists he is not a tourist and wants to be a monk despite being rejected and physically removed.
Insists on staying and becoming a Shaolin monk despite being told no and physically removed.
Refuses to leave and sits down to hold his ground like a child holding his breath.
Fails to persuade the monks or find a way to gain entry, resulting in being forcibly removed.
Gathers up his spilled clothing despite being laughed at, then sits quietly and accepts a cup of tea from Ashema.
Shares his feelings of rejection and disappointment openly with Ashema.
Continues to engage with Ashema and the old man despite his rough day and emotional slump.
Gathers up his spilled clothing and stuffs it back into his pack after his backpack is returned.
Sits down heavily and drinks multiple cups of tea, appearing to drink heavily after being kicked out of the temple.
Expresses determination to continue his goal of becoming a monk despite being kicked out, showing persistence and resolve.
Listens thoughtfully to Ashema's story and compliments the grandfather sincerely.
Decides to camp out in front of the temple overnight, showing determination but no direct interaction with others.
Does not respond to the Admissions Monk's angry command to leave.
Listens thoughtfully to the story about perseverance and the monk who refused to leave the temple until admitted.
Responds respectfully and appreciatively to the grandfather's story, showing emotional intelligence and social awareness.
Decides to camp out in front of the temple overnight, demonstrating determination, patience, and strategic persistence.
Does not respond verbally to the Admissions Monk's order to leave, showing calmness and possibly confidence in his decision.
Does not respond to the Admissions Monk's angry command to leave, simply sits quietly.
Endures torment from local kids without retaliation or complaint.
Accepts food silently from Ashema without speaking, but shows a small smile.
Smiles at the spider that lingers near him.
Sits in the rain looking miserable and wavering in spirit, but does not give up.

Endures physical discomfort and torment from local kids without reacting or giving up.
Shivers in the cold night, clearly uncomfortable but persists.

Looks at the relative comfort nearby but does not seek it, showing wavering spirit.
Allows children who previously tormented him to play around and with him, becoming part of their group.
Maintains firm determination and perseverance despite difficult conditions, showing resilience but no direct social interaction.

Sits silently and alone in the temple courtyard, not engaging with others.
Perseveres through difficult conditions (wind, rain) without being bothered.
Gains respect and admiration from the monks and local children through his persistence.
Maintains firm and solid form with visible determination during his vigil.
Sits alone in the courtyard for an extended period, showing patience and mental endurance.

Shares his feelings of loneliness and struggle openly, showing vulnerability.
Forms a symbolic friendship with a spider, showing openness and acceptance.
Does not display any negative or cold behavior in this excerpt.
Apologizes sincerely to San De after making fun of him, showing social awareness and humility.
Expresses his desire to become a monk despite initial discomfort and pain, demonstrating perseverance and commitment.
Describes overcoming boredom and loneliness by mentally adapting and finding power in the experience, indicating emotional intelligence and mental resilience.

Looks at Ashema and her Bau Bau and smiles before entering the temple despite feeling crushed and wary.

Celebrates Gao's success with a high-five and continues to play and have fun together.

Carries a young woman across a stream without hesitation, helping her without concern for consequences.
Smiles slightly and makes a lighthearted comment to Gao and Li after carrying the woman, showing a friendly and sincere demeanor.
Catches a difficult throw in stride after a subtle signal, demonstrating athletic skill and game awareness.
Carries a woman across a stream without hesitation, showing decisiveness and helpfulness.
Leaves Li and Gao puzzled by his cryptic remark about leaving the girl at the stream, showing confidence and a playful intelligence.
Engages in intense sparring with Gao, then bows and embraces him, smiling.
Snaps Gao with a towel while walking by, teasing him.
Uses a racial slur 'slant eye' during fight with Gao.
Engages in intense, full-power fighting with Gao, demonstrating skill and resilience despite being hit.
Recovers quickly after being unexpectedly hit and continues to fight aggressively.
Shows confidence and determination by responding to Gao's insult with renewed fighting spirit.
Stops fighting and bows to opponent, showing respect and understanding of martial arts etiquette.
Playfully snaps Gao with a towel while walking by, indicating a confident and relaxed demeanor.
Leaves the girl at the stream without explanation, causing confusion for others.
Returns the bow respectfully to Master San De before leaving on his quest.
Responds calmly and non-aggressively when confronted and attacked by thugs in the market.
Accepts a difficult quest with a sacred responsibility and prepares to leave early morning, showing readiness and respect.
Walks strong and confident through the countryside, indicating physical and mental preparedness.
Tries to peacefully retrieve his drink and avoid conflict despite provocation from thugs.
Is caught off guard and physically attacked by thugs, showing vulnerability in a hostile situation.
Stops the thug from slapping the young boy, fights off the thugs to protect the family, returns the stolen goods, kneels and sincerely connects with the boy.
Allows himself to be kicked and dirtied without retaliating initially, showing humility and restraint.
Politely refuses the woman's seduction, explaining his monk vows and gently but firmly setting boundaries.
Takes the woman's hands and makes her look him in the eye to communicate sincerity and respect.
Meditates alone at night, showing focus and discipline.
Works out intensely by the lake, concentrating on breathing and routines.
Remains committed to his monastic vows despite temptation from a seductive woman.
Initially hesitates and is unsure how to handle being naked in front of the woman.
Kisses her on the forehead before leaving, showing gentle affection.
Bows politely and uses a respectful phrase when tourists want pictures, despite feeling embarrassed.
Walks away from tourists without engaging further, indicating a desire for privacy but not rudeness.
Raises his hands and bows politely to tourists despite embarrassment, then calmly walks away.
Studies his map carefully before attempting to go through a dangerous waterfall path.
Is caught off guard and jostled by a sudden crowd of tourists, showing some initial surprise.
Carefully navigates dangerous terrain, showing caution and persistence.
Politely asks the man behind him if the rope can hold both of them.
Responds to the man's aggression by complying and hurrying without confrontation.
Concentrates and moves forward slowly but surely through dangerous terrain, showing persistence and carefulness.
Examines the distance between objects in the swamp and realizes he can jump across, demonstrating situational awareness and problem-solving.
Almost falls a couple of times but regains balance and gets a rhythm going, showing physical skill and resilience.
Jumps off the alligator's head quickly and carefully examines the next landing spot before continuing, showing quick reflexes and caution.
Smiles and confidently starts across the rope bridge despite the danger, showing confidence.
Questions the man behind him about the rope's strength, indicating awareness but perhaps underestimating the threat.
Hurries across the fraying rope bridge when he notices it is weakening, showing quick thinking under pressure.
Gets pushed and kicked to go faster by the man behind him, indicating he is under duress and possibly not fully in control of the situation.
Falls and slams into the wall when the rope snaps, losing the scroll in the process, indicating a failure to avoid a critical accident.
Chooses to save the man hanging from the cliff instead of the precious scroll, risking losing the scroll to save a life.
Carries the man to safety and shares a meal with him, showing concern and connection.
Feels dread and guilt about disappointing the arhat, indicating sincerity and responsibility.
Considers stealing or neglecting the scroll by thinking 'Maybe he won't miss one little scroll...'
Manages to pin the scroll to the cliff wall despite being groggy from impact.
Hesitates and is unsure whether to save the scroll or the man hanging below.
Chooses to save the man instead of the scroll, letting the box fall.
Successfully pulls the man up and carries him to safety.
Feels unhappy and dreads facing the arhat after losing the scroll.
Looks around the arhat's hut and considers hiding the loss of the scroll.
Apologizes sincerely to the Arhat for failing and accepts responsibility without excuses.
Shows respect by bowing multiple times to the Arhat.
Engages with the Arhat patiently and with humility despite receiving a cryptic and dismissive response.
Acknowledges his failure to the Arhat without making excuses and accepts the master's silent judgment.
Attempts to ask a profound question despite receiving a cryptic and seemingly nonsensical answer, showing persistence and openness.
Is left dumbstruck and somewhat confused by the Arhat's answer, indicating a momentary lack of understanding.
Bows respectfully to the Arhat and thanks him sincerely.
Laughs good-naturedly at the Arhat's unexpected advice about taking the bus.
Shakes his head with a smile after learning the bus schedule, showing humility and openness.
Questions the Arhat about how many succeeded, showing engagement and awareness.
Acknowledges that he did not obey initially but understands the lesson about questioning and self-obedience.
Laughs at the suggestion to take the bus, initially dismissing a simple solution.
Accepts the Arhat's advice about the bus and uses it to return to the temple efficiently.
Returns to the temple dirty and weary but triumphant, indicating perseverance and successful completion of a difficult task.
Smiles as he realizes the events were a test.
Leads disciples in training, encouraging them to tear down the building with enthusiasm.
Stands calmly while two full-sized disciples hang off his arm, showing patience and strength.
Walks alone through the temple courtyards, lost in thought, not engaging with others.
Rises to the challenge of the final test despite being excused, insists on passing the test and requests to be first.
Smiles at the D.S.'s playful smack and attempt to lighten the mood.
Rises to the challenge of the final test despite being told he need not enter the chamber.
Requests to be the first to enter the Wooden Man Chamber, showing confidence and initiative.
Responds with a smile to the D.S.'s playful smack, showing emotional composure and confidence.
Despite fear and physical pain, he perseveres and encourages himself with positive affirmations.
Initially caught off guard and hit several times by the wooden statues, showing fear and doubt.
Recalls his master's teaching and past success, regains composure, and re-enters the chamber with mental and physical preparation.
Blocks, avoids, rolls, jumps, and redirects attacks skillfully, making progress across the chamber.
Quickly adjusts to an unexpected fierce attack and successfully evades it.
Blocks and misdirects two deadly spears aimed at him, demonstrating quick reflexes and control.
Holds up a heavy stone panel with his arm while completely relaxed, demonstrating control and calm under pressure.
Taps the whirling statue in the face and says 'Not this time,' showing determination and a bit of humor.
Embraces and congratulates other disciples as they complete the challenge, showing support and friendliness.
Embraces and congratulates fellow disciples who made it through the chamber.
Excuses himself from the party to approach San De respectfully and sincerely thanks him.
Listens thoughtfully and smiles appreciatively at San De's story.
Excuses himself from the party to seek out San De for a private conversation, showing initiative and respect.
Acknowledges that he wouldn't have made it through without San De's help, demonstrating humility and self-awareness.
Listens thoughtfully to San De's story and processes the information with a smile, indicating emotional intelligence and reflection.
Agrees immediately and with a smile to help at the international tournament in Beijing without hesitation.
Approaches Ashema gently, lifts her chin to look at her face, and kisses away her fear, showing tenderness and care.
Walks hand in hand with Ashema and bows respectfully to fellow monks, demonstrating friendliness and respect.
Offers to help in any way he can regarding the tournament, showing willingness and support.
Agrees immediately and confidently to help at an international tournament without hesitation.
Approaches Ashema gently, reads her emotions, and comforts her effectively.
Dresses appropriately for the competition and shows respect by bowing to fellow monks.
Asks if they are late, showing awareness of timing and situation.
Offers help proactively to San De regarding the upcoming fight.
Remains silent and stunned when Trevor approaches and mocks him and others, does not retaliate or respond to provocation.
Does not intervene or react when Trevor inappropriately touches Ashema and makes disrespectful comments.
Is dumbstruck and silent when confronted by Trevor's taunts and provocations.
Stares after Trevor without responding or taking action while witnessing Trevor's showboating and destruction of the Shaolin fighter.
Refuses to fight Trevor despite crowd pressure, stating that martial arts are not about proving who is best but about something more important.
Acknowledges his ego was the real opponent, showing self-awareness and humility.
Walks away from confrontation and bows respectfully to Trevor and San De, demonstrating sincerity and respect.
Climbs into the ring to face Trevor despite uncertainty, showing willingness to confront a challenge.
States that beating Trevor is no longer important and that ego had to be defeated, demonstrating insight and emotional intelligence.
Walks out of the ring instead of fighting when the crowd and others expect a fight, showing confidence in his principles over public expectation.
Appears unsure what to do initially when challenged, indicating some hesitation or lack of immediate decisiveness.
Refuses to fight for personal glory or ego, showing calm and restraint.
Accepts the responsibility to fight to defend the temple's honor, showing loyalty and respect.
Shares a high-five with Gao and Li, indicating camaraderie and team spirit.
Sits alone in his corner, contrasting with Trevor's entourage, showing humility and independence.
Refuses to fight for personal glory or ego, showing calm and self-control.
Understands the implication of San De's words and accepts the challenge thoughtfully.
Walks confidently to the ring and prepares for the fight with composure.
Smiles and lifts defeated opponent Trevor up, shakes his hand, and puts an arm around him to steady him in front of the crowd instead of delivering a knockout punch.
Uses soft gong fu to easily avoid attacks and frustrate opponent.
Decides to end the fight quickly by overwhelming opponent with superior technique.
Chooses to spare opponent a knockout punch and instead shows sportsmanship by helping him up and shaking his hand.
Rushes up to San De and gives him a hug after receiving the Golden Sash.
Bows respectfully to San De before and after receiving the Golden Sash.
Stands with Trevor in the center of the ring as monks celebrate with him.
Allows Ashema to take his arm and walk with him along the Great Wall.
Receives the Golden Sash from San De, demonstrating mastery and recognition by the monks.
Performs the beginning of a Shaolin form on the Great Wall confidently.
Rushes to hug San De, showing emotional openness despite cultural differences.
